definition: to run/to rush about/to be on the go
to go to/to head for/towards
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to spread the news (idiom)

sentences.english: An actor circling the stage suggests a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 而演員繞臺奔走則代表長途跋涉。

sentences.english: My legs felt weak after a day of running around.
sentences.chinese: 一整天四處奔走之後我的腿軟了。

sentences.english: And the living creatures ran and returned as the appearance of a flash of lightning.
sentences.chinese: 這活物往來奔走，好像電光一閃。

sentences.english: She was driven from pillar to post. Each person she spoke to was more unhelpful than the last.
sentences.chinese: 她四處奔走，和她談話的人一個不如一個有用處。

sentences.english: Minister rushed about the camp praying and exhorting.
sentences.chinese: 牧師在營地到處奔走，一邊禱告，一邊勸戒。

sentences.english: I run as musk-deer in the shadow of the forest mad with his own perfume.
sentences.chinese: 我像麋鹿一樣在林蔭中奔走，爲着自己的香氣而發狂。

sentences.english: Bibo Dangyang relieve the river, the radical Longyi running.
sentences.chinese: 河水緩處碧波盪漾，急處龍蛇奔走。

sentences.english: They w ere campaigning to keep the local school open.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲使當地學校不致關閉而奔走活動。

sentences.english: She's been tramping the streets looking for a job.
sentences.chinese: 她一直在大街上四處奔走尋找工作。

sentences.english: He travelled great distances, to more than 60 countries in three years.
sentences.chinese: 三年時間裏，他長途奔走，足跡遍及60多個國家。

sentences.english: 'We'll have two firms bird-dogging for us.
sentences.chinese: 會有兩個公司爲我們奔走。

sentences.english: In the factories the workers shouted the good news to each other.
sentences.chinese: 在工廠裏，工人都把這個好消息奔走相告。

sentences.english: I run as a musk-deer runs in the shadow of the forest mad with his own perfume.
sentences.chinese: 我像麝鹿一樣在林蔭中奔走，爲着自己的香氣而發狂。

sentences.english: Four flees vast for Ting, makes Ting's unjust charge to seem to be that comes to light the time.
sentences.chinese: 浩爲婷四出奔走，令婷的冤獄似有水落石出之期。

sentences.english: Now she is an activist for homeless people in Seattle, Washington.
sentences.chinese: 她現在是華盛頓西雅圖市爲流浪者積極奔走的人。

sentences.english: Accompanying the peripatetic Secretary of State on his shuttle diplomacy marathons.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨四處奔走的國務卿於穿梭外交的馬拉松旅途上。

definition: to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to rush about on errands/to be kept on the run
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
dealings/contacts/to go back and forth
to spare no effort
in order to/because of/for the sake of
to trudge/to trek
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
(idiom) terribly busy/up to one's ears in work
to exhaust one's thoughts and ingenuity (idiom); to think sth through thoroughly/to rack one's brains/to leave no stone unturned
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to toss about in bed/from person to person/indirectly/to wander
